game

Class DataHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.DataHandler

  • public class DataHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    A DataHandler is an object that can read in level-information from text files and create the appropriate in-game constructs. It provides static methods for the handling of settings and control over a String to Color (and vice versa) mapping is implemented.
    Author:
    Sean Lewis

        public java.util.ArrayList<Level> getLevelData(java.lang.String fileName)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Reads in all level data from the file and returns an ArrayList of the levels.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file all information is in
        Returns:
        ArrayList of constructed levels
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any input error occurred

      • getColorDisplay

        public static java.lang.String getColorDisplay(java.awt.Color c)
        Returns a String representation of this color.
        Parameters:
        c - a Color
        Returns:
        a String that contains the three pigment values

      • readColor

        public static java.awt.Color readColor(java.lang.String str)
        Reads in a Sting representation of a Color and creates the appropriate Color object. If the color could not be read (i.e. the input string is not a valid color representation) null is returned.
        Parameters:
        str - a parameter
        Returns:
        the Color object specified by the input String

      • printSettings

        public static void printSettings(boolean[] settings,
                 int speed)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Prints the current game settings to settings.txt.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if settings.txt cannot be written to
